item.title: Revising Scorn & Fool incompatibility
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
anon97870008:

Fool cannot win together with anyone, because he’s dead, when he has won…

Even if you interpret “can win together” that strictly, it’s still strictly wrong, since Scorned can win with Fool if he’s their second executed mark. And if that’s the intended meaning then it should be clarified because I am highly skeptical the average player ever interpreted it the way you do here.

Arete:

Fool and Scorned exist is to counter purely mechanical deduction

Sure but making Scorned incompatible with everyone promotes mechanical deduction. Literally no reason for Scorned to be incompatible with everyone, is there?

Arete:

If Fool matched everyone by default there would be nearly no risk to the strategy where you just yoloexecute the more suspicious half of an incomp check.

“No risk”? Fool has 2 frames …
